intro: Hieracium leucodaedalum, commonly known as the white-veined hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, preferring sunny to partially shaded conditions. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while the flowers are small and yellow, often with white veins. It is known for its ornamental value and can be found in botanical gardens and natural habitats.
